titlestmt.titleproper: Rev. Eugene Alphonse Solega Collection CPAA 94.15
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jordan Sorensen

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-03-31T08:59-0400

did.unittitle: Rev. Eugene Alphonse Solega Collection
did.abstract: The collection of Rev. Eugene A. Solega, native of Hartford, CT, shows the life of a second generation Polish American priest. Rev. Solega held several pastoral assignments in Connecticut. Throughout his life he was involved with several organizations, religious or not, including several social organizations helping women, young people, and displaced persons from Europe. The collection holds items related to his education and pastoral work, including handwritten notes, photographs, and newspaper articles.
did.langmaterial: Mostly English, some correspondence, pamphlets, magazines and clippings in Polish

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection spans most of the life of Rev. Eugene Solega, covering mostly his educational and religious life. It does include his parent’s naturalization papers from before his birth but the bulk of material is within the dates of 1934 to 1983. Besides some medical records from later in his life, there is nothing included that relates to his death. Most items are personal notebooks from seminary, correspondence, official programs/memorabilia from services or ceremonies, newspaper clippings, and photographs.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Rev. Eugene A. Solega was born in Hartford on June 10, 1915 to parents Adam and Tekla Solega, Polish immigrants. He attended S.S. Cyril and Methodius parochial school in Hartford. He then attended St. Thomas Seminary in Bloomfield for six years. Bishop McAuliffe appointed him to study philosophy and theology at St. Mary’s Seminary in Baltimore, MD. and was ordained on May 22, 1941. His first assignment was to St. Joseph parish in Rockville where he served from June 29, 1941 to November 11, 1949. His second appointment was to St. Mary’s church in Middletown from Nov. 11, 1949 until April 27, 1960, where he was also the principal of the religious school. During his time in Middletown, he became the moderator of the Middletown District of Catholic Women and the Associate Director of Catholic Charities. His third appointment was to St. Bridget church in Moodus on April 27, 1960. His final appointment was for the St. John’s church in Old Saybrook on June 5, 1969. Father Solega participated in various community activities throughout his life. He was a member of the Community Chest Board of Directors, Red Cross Advisory Board, Association of Polish Priests in Connecticut and chaplain of the Knights of Columbus and Catholic War Veterans. He was a president of the Middletown Exchange Club and worked with the Catholic Youth Organization in the state together with Msgr. John Wodarski. He became a Director of Diocesan of Resettlement for displaced persons to the US from Europe in the 1950’s. He died on August 18, 1985.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Rev. Eugene Alphonse Solega Collection (CPAA 94-15). Connecticut Polish American Archives, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.

controlaccess.occupation: Association of Polish Priests in Connecticut

did.unittitle: Rev. Eugene A. Solega – Naturalization papers of Tekla and Adam Solega (parents); life insurance policies.
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – Newspaper clippings about ordination to priesthood, May 22, 1941. One full edition of The Catholic Transcript from the same date with Solega’s photo.
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – health insurance, doctors visits

Rev. Eugene A. Solega – Association of Polish Priests in Connecticut, visit of Polish bishops, related correspondence, minutes, 1975-1976. Polish Studies Program Report, 1976 from CCSU, “Poles in the Bicentennial U.S.A” by Msgr. Fiedorczyk, 1977.
Rev. Eugene A. Solega - Association of Polish Priests in Connecticut, the National Czestochowa Shrine Trust Appeal, related correspondence and publicity, 1976
Rev. Eugene A. Solega - Association of Polish Priests in Connecticut, 1983. Minutes of the previous meeting and letter about "Radio Free Europe."
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – Address at the Unknown Soldier Memorial Day, Grove Hill Cemetery, Rockville, CT (in English), May 30, 1946
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – various speeches, addresses, testimonials, programs & a packet of jokes about different topics (1947, 1959, 1962 were dates notated)
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – Homily for 75th Anniversary of SS. Cyril & Methodius (in Polish), April 24, 1977
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – testimonial dinner honoring Rev. Solega retiring Associate Director of Catholic Charities, March 3, 1964; Rev. Eugene A. Solega – testimonial Guest Book, March 3, 1964
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – 25th anniversary of Priesthood, 1966: celebration and newspaper article
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – 40th Anniversary of Priesthood, related correspondence, invitations, clippings, May 24, 1981
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – St. Bridget Centennial Anniversary Booklet, 1967
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – St. Bridget Centennial, clippings and photographs, 1967
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – St. Bridget church, Moodus, CT, death register from May 12, 1960 – March 15, 1969
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – writings related to mystics (1936), hope and hypnotism.
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – book reviews related to economics, socialism, and ethics. No date noted but probably from time in seminary.
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – papers and readings from seminary, 1937-1940
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – invitations for religious celebrations and testimonials from all over Connecticut, 1947-1983
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – notes on various religious topics. (Mostly Bible related)
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – correspondence with organizations, postcards, notice of assignments to churches, personal cards, 1936-1972
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – Knights of Columbus Old Saybrook, CT services/meetings. 1977
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – holy cards 1934,1958-1982
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – The Stella Matutina Quarterly, St. Thomas Seminary, 1934, 1935, 1941 (Solega’s Graduation), The Golden Jubilee Celebration, 1947
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – post cards with local churches and tourist attractions. Only a few dates given on correspondence.
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – individual income tax.
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – newspaper clippings related to Rev. Solega, 1935-76
Rev. Eugene A. Solega - clippings related to Polish American clergy, political issues, & sports, 1941-1950 (Musiel in one)
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – Toastmaster at Felician Sisters Centennial, Nov. 3, 1974
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – resolution of participation in the Conn. District Exchange Clubs. No dates notated, just researched dates of conventions.
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – St. Bridget Parrish annual financial report and regulations, 1966-1968
Various publications and pamphlets, The Catholic Advocate, 1944-1950.
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – misc. catholic memorabilia and notes, 1950's and 1960's.
“The Herald St. Joseph School News”, v. I, no.1, Spring Edition; “The Heynal. St. Joseph School”, Rockville, CT, v. II, no. 2. Dates are the years he was in Rockville.
Graduation pictures from St. Joseph School, Rockville, CT 1943-1947
Anthony Sadlak, congressman at large, testimonial dinner, Rockville, CT 1947 (2 photos)

Collection of photographs – blessing of construction for a new church by Bishop O’Brien, participating priests: Solega, H. Fiedorczyk, Kloczko, Bombolinski, 1954
Rev. Eugene A. Solega – 2nd Annual Meeting, Norwich Diocesan Bureau of Social Services, May 6, 1956 (1 photo); National Catholic Cem. Conference, Washington D.C., Oct. 22, 1959 (1 photo)
Collection of photographs – St. Mary’s church, Middletown CT, inside church 40th Anniversary, 1952.
Collection of photographs – golden Jubilee of St. Mary’s church, Middletown, CT. No date known for event, dates represent Solega's appointment there.

Rev. Eugene Solega’s notes from seminary on homilitics, patrology and history of the Church, history of philosophy, public speaking, cosmology, economics, education, dogma, canon law, scripture, and morals 1935-1941
